SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.edugility.nomen
Class Name

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.nomen.AbstractValued
      com.edugility.nomen.Name
All Implemented Interfaces:
Valued, Serializable
public class Name
extends AbstractValued

A Serializable AbstractValued implementation that is a combination of a NameValue and the Named that it is currently assigned to.

A Name may be a name for a party or agent or less tangible concept. There is no guarantee that a Name serves as any kind of unique identifier.

Two Names are considered equal if their values are equal. Note in particular that for equality purposes a Name's owner is deliberately not also considered.

The value of a Name may change, since the value of its associated NameValue may change. Bear this in mind if you are using Names as keys in a Map. In normal usage, however, a Name is set up and then not further altered.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
getValue(), computeValue(), NameValue, Named, Valued, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Name

protected Name()
Creates a new Name in an initially useless state. This no-argument constructor is provided for JPA compatibility and serialization purposes. Callers must typically subsequently call setNamed(Named) and setNameValue(NameValue).

See Also:
Name(Named, NameValue), setNamed(Named), setNameValue(NameValue)

Name

public Name(Named named,
            String nameValue)
Creates a new Name that is owned by the supplied Named.

This constructor calls the Name(Named, NameValue) constructor.

Parameters:
named - the Named named by this Name; may be null in which case this Name is for all intents and purposes just a glorified NameValue
nameValue - the value that this Name will have; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if nameValue is null

Name

public Name(Named named,
            NameValue nameValue)
Creates a new Name that is owned by the supplied Named.

This constructor calls the Name(Named, NameValue) constructor.

Parameters:
named - the Named named by this Name; may be null in which case this Name is for all intents and purposes just a glorified NameValue
nameValue - the NameValue that represents the actual name value; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if nameValue is null

Name

public Name(NameValue nameValue)
Creates a new Name with the supplied NameValue that is initially unowned. The caller is expected to call setNamed(Named) with a non-null Named to complete initialization.

Parameters:
nameValue - the NameValue that represents the actual name value; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if nameValue is null
Method Detail

getNamed

public Named getNamed()
Returns the Named that owns this Name.

This method may return null, in which case this Name is unowned.

Returns:
a Named that serves as this Name's owner, or null if this Name is unowned

setNamed

public void setNamed(Named named)
Sets the Named that will serve as this Name's owner. If the supplied Named is identical to the Named returned by the getNamed() method, no action is taken.

Parameters:
named - the new owner; may be null

getNameValue

public NameValue getNameValue()
Returns the NameValue fundamentally bound to this Name.

This method may return null if the no-argument constructor has been used to construct this Name and a subsequent call to setNameValue(NameValue) or setValue(String) has not yet been issued.

Returns:
a NameValue, or null
See Also:
setNameValue(NameValue)

setNameValue

public void setNameValue(NameValue nameValue)
Installs the NameValue that this Name fundamentally has as its value.

Parameters:
nameValue - the NameValue to install; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if nameValue is null or not initialized
IllegalStateException - if the supplied NameValue is not atomic and there was a problem interpolating the template it logically represents; examine the root cause for details
See Also:
getNameValue(), NameValue.isAtomic(), NameValue.setAtomic(boolean)

getValue

public String getValue()
Returns the result of evaluating this Name's associated NameValue against this Name's associated Named as an MVEL template.

This method never returns null.

Implementation Notes

This method calls the computeValue() method and returns its result.

Specified by:
getValue in interface Valued
Overrides:
getValue in class AbstractValued
Returns:
a non-null String with the just-in-time-computed value of this Name
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if there was a problem compiling the template
See Also:
computeValue()

toString

protected String toString(Object object)
Converts the supplied Object to a String.

The default implementation of this method never returns null, but overrides are permitted to relax this restriction.

This implementation returns the empty string if the supplied Object is null, and otherwise returns the result of the supplied object's Object.toString() method.

This method is called by the computeValue() method.

Parameters:
object - the Object to convert; may be null
Returns:
a String representing the conversion, or null

computeValue

protected String computeValue()
Computes and returns the most up-to-date value possible for this Name.

This method never returns null.

This method is not declared final only so that this class may be used as a JPA entity.

Returns:
a non-null String representing this Name's value
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if there was a problem compiling a template

addPropertyChangeListener

public void addPropertyChangeListener(String name,
                                      PropertyChangeListener listener)
Adds the supplied PropertyChangeListener to this Name, listening for changes to the JavaBeans property identified by the value of the name parameter.

If the supplied PropertyChangeListener has already been added, it will be added again.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.addPropertyChangeListener(String, PropertyChangeListener).

Parameters:
name - the name of the property to be listened to; if null then no action will be taken
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to add; if null, then no action will be taken
See Also:
getPropertyChangeListeners(String), PropertyChangeSupport.addPropertyChangeListener(String, PropertyChangeListener)

addPropertyChangeListener

public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
Adds the supplied PropertyChangeListener to this Name. The supplied PropertyChangeListener will be notified of all property changes fired by this Name.

If the supplied PropertyChangeListener has already been added, it will be added again.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener).

Parameters:
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to add; if null, then no action will be taken
See Also:
getPropertyChangeListeners(), PropertyChangeSupport.addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener)

removePropertyChangeListener

public void removePropertyChangeListener(String name,
                                         PropertyChangeListener listener)
Removes the supplied PropertyChangeListener from this Name, so that it will no longer be listening for changes to the JavaBeans property identified by the value of the name parameter.

If the supplied PropertyChangeListener has been added more than once, only one instance will be removed, and it is undefined which instance will be removed.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.removePropertyChangeListener(String, PropertyChangeListener).

Parameters:
name - the name of the property to be listened to; if null then no action will be taken
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to add; if null, then no action will be taken
See Also:
addPropertyChangeListener(String, PropertyChangeListener), getPropertyChangeListeners(String), PropertyChangeSupport.removePropertyChangeListener(String, PropertyChangeListener)

removePropertyChangeListener

public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
Removes the supplied PropertyChangeListener from this Name, so that it will no longer be listening for changes to JavaBeans properties exposed by the Name class.

If the supplied PropertyChangeListener has been added more than once, only one instance will be removed, and it is undefined which instance will be removed.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener).

Parameters:
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to add; if null, then no action will be taken
See Also:
addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener), getPropertyChangeListeners(), PropertyChangeSupport.removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener)

getPropertyChangeListeners

public PropertyChangeListener[] getPropertyChangeListeners(String name)
Returns a non-null array of the PropertyChangeListeners that have been added to this Name and that are listening for changes in the property identified by the supplied name.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.getPropertyChangeListeners(String).

Parameters:
name - the name of the property in question; may be null in which case a non-null empty PropertyChangeListener array will be returned
Returns:
a non-null, possibly empty, array of PropertyChangeListeners
See Also:
PropertyChangeSupport.getPropertyChangeListeners(String)

getPropertyChangeListeners

public PropertyChangeListener[] getPropertyChangeListeners()
Returns a non-null array of the PropertyChangeListeners that have been added to this Name and that are listening for changes in all properties exposed by the Name class.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.getPropertyChangeListeners().

Returns:
a non-null, possibly empty, array of PropertyChangeListeners
See Also:
PropertyChangeSupport.getPropertyChangeListeners()

firePropertyChange

protected void firePropertyChange(String propertyName,
                                  Object old,
                                  Object newValue)
If appropriate, notifies registered PropertyChangeListeners of a possible change in the property named by the supplied propertyName parameter.

This method delegates to PropertyChangeSupport.firePropertyChange(String, Object, Object).

This method is not declared final only so that this class may be used as a JPA entity.

Parameters:
propertyName - the name of the property that has changed; may be null
old - the old value for the property; may be null
newValue - the newValue for the property; may be null
See Also:
PropertyChangeSupport.firePropertyChange(String, Object, Object)

name

public static Name name(AbstractNamed named,
                        String nameTypeValue,
                        String nameValue)
A convenience method that creates and installs a new non-atomic Name into the supplied AbstractNamed.

Design Notes

This method is not declared final only so that this class may be used as a JPA entity. The JPA specification requires that no method on a potential entity may be final.

Implementation Notes

This method calls the name(AbstractNamed, String, String, boolean, String) method passing false and a space character (" ") as the value of the penultimate and final parameters, and returns its return value.

Parameters:
named - the AbstractNamed that will own the new Name; must not be null
nameTypeValue - the identifying information for the relevant NameType under which a new Name will be indexed; must not be null
nameValue - the identifying information for the relevant NameValue; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null Name owned by the supplied AbstractNamed under an appropriate NameType
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either named, nameTypeValue or nameValue is null.

name

public static Name name(AbstractNamed named,
                        String nameTypeValue,
                        String nameValue,
                        boolean atomic)
A convenience method that creates and installs a new non-atomic Name into the supplied AbstractNamed.

Design Notes

This method is not declared final only so that this class may be used as a JPA entity. The JPA specification requires that no method on a potential entity may be final.

Implementation Notes

This method calls the name(AbstractNamed, String, String, boolean, String) method passing a space character (" ") as the value of the final parameter, and returns its return value.

Parameters:
named - the AbstractNamed that will own the new Name; must not be null
nameTypeValue - the identifying information for the relevant NameType under which a new Name will be indexed; must not be null
nameValue - the identifying information for the relevant NameValue; must not be null
atomic - whether the nameValue parameter is notionally atomic
Returns:
a non-null Name owned by the supplied AbstractNamed under an appropriate NameType
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either named, nameTypeValue or nameValue is null.

name

public static Name name(AbstractNamed named,
                        String nameTypeValue,
                        String nameValue,
                        boolean atomic,
                        String whitespaceReplacement)
A convenience method that creates and installs a new non-atomic Name into the supplied AbstractNamed.

Design Notes

This method is not declared final only so that this class may be used as a JPA entity. The JPA specification requires that no method on a potential entity may be final.

Parameters:
named - the AbstractNamed that will own the new Name; must not be null
nameTypeValue - the identifying information for the relevant NameType under which a new Name will be indexed; must not be null
nameValue - the identifying information for the relevant NameValue; must not be null
atomic - whether the nameValue parameter is notionally atomic
whitespaceReplacement - the String to use in replacing whitespace characters; may be null in which case no whitespace replacement will occur. A good reasonable default is a single space (" ").
Returns:
a non-null Name owned by the supplied AbstractNamed under an appropriate NameType
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either named, nameTypeValue or nameValue is null.
